result.execSummary:
The defendant Hector M Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*** 10-1-2018/Judge T. Christopher Dee; Court orders the judgment of conviction amended to reflect a date of birth for the defendant of April 4, 1974.***
Consecutive to: (STRAIGHT TIME), consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 73 (seventy-three) days time served.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA and domestic abuse surcharge) during the period of probation. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of
 a civil judgment.
 Restitution is set at $0 (zero).
No contact with victim Dawn S. unless permitted by the agent.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling. 
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Agent will notify parties of probation review hearing.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 180 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 73 (seventy-three) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.

AS TO COUNT 2 AS AMENDED:

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
               
     *   Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
          counseling. 
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with victim Dawn S. unless permitted by the agent. 
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA  
           and domestic abuse surcharge) during the period of probation.
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due 
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Federal firearm provision.
     *   Restitution is set at $0 (zero).
     *   Agent will notify parties of probation review hearing. Court vacated Jury trial on April 20, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 23.


 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Hector M Rodriguez in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Hector M Rodriguez in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNT 2 AS AMENDED:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Hector M Rodriguez not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before speedy disposition court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

At the parties request, case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing on 04/10/2015 at 01:30 p.m. in Room 634 of the Courthouse, Judge Dee presiding.
cab

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Hector M Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference. Defendant NOT produced for today's hearing. Defense counsel did not waive defendant's appearance. Court unable to proceed with hearing, case is adjourned for next scheduled court date of 4/20/2015 at 8:30 AM for Jury Trial in branch 23.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Hector M Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski for Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Branch 23 in trial, case addressed off the record. Case set for a Final Pretrial Conference. Parties working toward resolution. Defendant NOT produced for Final Pretrial Conference, defense counsel requests and state stipulates to matter be set for a Status Conference in branch 23. Matter remains set for Jury trial in branch 23 on 4/20/2015 at 8:30 AM.  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hector M Rodriguez in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Hector M Rodriguez in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense requested Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to Jury Trial. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DAWN S. OR HER CHILDREN; SANDRA R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Hector M Rodriguez in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Hector M Rodriguez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
